title: Great Wall Motor Tumbles Most in 14 Months After Placement Plan
text:
Great Wall Motor Co. slumped by the most in more than 14 months in Hong Kong intraday trading after the board approved a plan to raise as much as $2.7 billion in a private share placement.
Great Wall fell by as much as 19 percent and traded 11 percent lower at HK$33.85 as of 9:44 a.m. in Hong Kong trading. The benchmark Hang Seng Index slid 1 percent.
The maker of China’s best-selling SUV model is raising funds to pay for the research and development of new-energy vehicles. Policy makers are tightening fuel standards and promoting electric vehicles in order to control pollution and reduce a reliance on imported oil.
Great Wall’s board approved the proposal to issue as many as 387 million A shares in Shanghai at 43.41 yuan each to fewer than 10 securities investment and management companies, the company said in a statement to the Hong Kong stock exchange on July 10.
